Class KivaKeli

  • java.lang.Object
    • KivaKeli
  • public class KivaKeli
extends java.lang.Object
    Print current temperature and weather condition in Finnish with UNIX-like command-line options. Takes POSIX-standard command-line flags to modify settings in runtime: -h help message -l location, eg. "Turku" -u temperature unit symbol, eg. C OpenWeatherMap API key is stored locally in file api_key.txt in the current working directory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KivaKeli

        public KivaKeli()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Fetches OWM API key, parses command-line options and then prints weather information for the user. Takes POSIX standard command-line flags to modify settings in runtime. The OpenWeatherMap API key is stored locally in file api_key.txt in the current working directory. API key is interactively asked, if the file is not in the working directory.
        Parameters:
        args - command-line arguments, POSIX standard flags

      • argParser

        public static void argParser​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Simple way to parse POSIX-standard command-line arguments. Sets application settings according to the flags provided by the user: - location - temperature unit - prints help message
        Parameters:
        args - raw command-line arguments

      • askApiKey

        public static java.lang.String askApiKey()
        Asks user for OpenWeatherMap API-key and returns it as a String.
        Returns:
        OpenWeatherMap API-key

      • buildCityUrl

        public static java.lang.String buildCityUrl​(java.lang.String loc,
                                            java.lang.String apiKey,
                                            char unit)
        Builds the OpenWeatherMap API URL, from city name, api key and temperature unit parametres and returns the URL.
        Parameters:
        loc - city name and optionally country code
        apiKey - OpenWeatherMap api key
        unit - wanted temperature unit, 'C' or 'F' expected, if parametre is empty or invalid, Kelvin units are used instead
        Returns:
        full API url

      • buildGeoUrl

        public static java.lang.String buildGeoUrl​(java.lang.String lat,
                                           java.lang.String lon,
                                           java.lang.String apiKey,
                                           char unit)
        Builds the OpenWeatherMap API URL, from geographical coordinates, the API KEY and temperature unit.
        Parameters:
        lat - latitude coordinate
        lon - longitude coordinate
        apiKey - OpenWeatherMap API key
        unit - temperature symbol, 'C' or 'F' expected, but if parametre is empty or invalid, Kelvin units are used instead
        Returns:
        full API URL

      • getUnitKeyword

        public static java.lang.String getUnitKeyword​(char unit)
        Convert character temperature unit symbol to API expected keyword. If the unit symbol is not 'C' or 'F', continue with kelvin "standard".
        Parameters:
        unit - Temperature unit symbol, 'C' or 'F' expected
        Returns:
        api expected keyword ("metric", "imperial", or "standard")

      • httpRequest

        public static java.lang.String httpRequest​(java.lang.String inputUrl)
                                    throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Returns the http GET response content from the url given as a parametre.
        Parameters:
        inputUrl - url used to fetch GET response
        Returns:
        GET response
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException

      • incrementStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] incrementStringArray​(java.lang.String[] org)
        Increase the size of provided String array by one. The content of the array will be copied to the new array with increased size.
        Parameters:
        org - original array to be incremented
        Returns:
        new array with larger size

      • ipGeoLoc

        public static java.lang.String[] ipGeoLoc()
                                   throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException,
                                          java.net.MalformedURLException
        Fetches geographical coordinates (latitude and longitude) from ip-api using the current user IP address. The coordinates are stored in String array, where the first value is the latitude coordinate and the second value is the longitude coordinate.
        Returns:
        user latitude and longitude coordinates in String array
        Throws:
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        java.net.MalformedURLException

      • keyFileManager

        public static java.lang.String keyFileManager()
        Checks if the "api_key.txt" exists - if not, ask the user for the key and write it, and then the method returns the API-key as a String. If the "api_key.txt" file does exist, the API-key is read from the file. If the file does not exist, user is asked to input the API-key, which is then written to the file.
        Returns:
        API-key from the file or user input

      • parseField

        public static java.lang.String parseField​(java.lang.String json,
                                          java.lang.String field)
                                   throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Convenience method, parses JSON document for the matching field. Parses the first found field matching the field String from the json String and returns the field's value as a String. for example: "field": "returned value"
        Parameters:
        json - JSON document to be parsed
        field - name of the field on the document to be parsed
        Returns:
        value from the field in the document
        Throws:
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException

      • parseArray

        public static java.lang.String[] parseArray​(java.lang.String json,
                                            java.lang.String field,
                                            java.lang.String finalField)
                                     throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Convenience method, parses JSON document for mathing fields in matching JSON array. Parses the first found JSON array from the document matching the field String. From this array parses the the matching fields and returns the fields' values as a String array. for example: "field": [ "finalField": "returned value" ]
        Parameters:
        json - JSON document to be parsed
        field - name of the array in the document to be parsed
        finalField - name of the field in the array to be parsed
        Returns:
        value from the field in the array
        Throws:
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException

      • printWeather

        public static void printWeather​(java.lang.String apiKey)
                         throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException,
                                java.net.MalformedURLException
        Prints current weather based on current device network location or city name. Possible city name or temperature unit is referenced and not given as parametre.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - OpenWeatherMap API key
        unit - temperature unit symbol
        Throws:
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        java.net.MalformedURLException
